metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18360 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In change_port_settings in drivers/usb/serial/io_ti.c in the Linux kernelbefore 4.11.3, local users could cause a denial of service bydivision-by-zero in the serial device layer by trying to set very high baudrates.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18360` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-83.106
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-83.106
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-83.106
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1061-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1061.69
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1063-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1063.68
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1022.31
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.11.0-1009.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-83.106').
